Description: Rim and neck sherd of Attic black-figured pottery volute-krater; interior glazed black; band in added red below rim; top of rim reserved; exterior: on outside face of rim, key meander to left; on neck, part of lotus and palmette frieze (added red on palmette centre).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Piekarski compares this sherd to the neck-amphora Cambridge, Fitzwilliam Museum GR 30. 1864 (ABV 340.1; CVA III H 19f, pl. 12, 2) but the execution of the lotus and palmette frieze is quite different.
Bibliographic references: Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p.39, no. C11, pl. 13, no. 3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0992)
